 About the CSE Department
 The Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) Department at City University is designed to provide students with the skills and knowledge required to excel in the dynamic field of technology. With a curriculum focused on practical learning, innovation, and research, the department offers:

 - Modern Labs: Fully equipped computer labs with the latest hardware and software.
 - Experienced Faculty: A team of highly qualified professors and industry experts.
 - Internship Opportunities: Collaborations with top companies to provide hands-on experience.
 - Project-Based Learning: Develop real-world projects to enhance technical skills.

 Admission Details
 - Total Program Fee: BDT 340,000 (Includes tuition fees, lab fees, and other necessary costs.)
 - Yearly Semesters: 2 Semesters per Year (Spring and Fall Semesters)
 - Program Duration: 4 Years (8 Semesters)

 Scholarship Opportunities
 City University offers various scholarships and financial aid programs based on:
 - Academic performance (HSC/SSC results).
 - Merit-based exams.
 - Need-based scholarships.

 Facilities for Students
 - State-of-the-Art Campus: Wi-Fi-enabled campus, library, and research facilities.
 - Clubs and Societies: Participate in tech clubs, coding competitions, and hackathons.
 - Career Support: Career guidance and placement services after graduation.

 Why Choose CSE at City University?
 - Job-Oriented Curriculum: Designed to meet industry demands.
 - Affordable Tuition Fees: Competitive program costs for high-quality education.
 - Supportive Learning Environment: Personalized guidance from faculty.
 - Focus on Emerging Technologies: AI, Data Science, IoT, Cybersecurity, and more.

 How to Apply?
 1. Visit the official website: City University Admission Portal.
 2. Collect the application form online or from the admission office.
 3. Submit your SSC and HSC certificates, passport-sized photographs, and application fees.
 4. Appear for the admission test (if applicable).
 5. Confirm your seat by completing the enrollment process.
